intro: Melodorum pallens, commonly known as the pale melodia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Gesneriaceae. It is native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil. The plant is characterized by its striking, elongated leaves and showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
